name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Reinforcing cover to formwork
Acceptance Criteria - TABLE 20.2.2: CONCRETE EXPOSURE CLASSIFICATION — MINIMUM COVER FOR 100 YEAR DESIGN LIFE
Exposure Classification || Specified Compressive Strength (f'c) — 30 MPa, 40 MPa, 50 MPa
2.02 - Reinforcing & Formwork - Reo placement and bar bending
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Reo placement and bar bending
Specification Reference - Ensure reinforcing bends comform to NZ standards and project specifications
Acceptance Criteria - Bars shall be cut and bent in accordance with NZS 3109 to the shapes indictated in the drawings and placed correctly in the arrangement shown;
○ Unless noted on drawings reinforcing bars to be bent to min bend diameters outlined in NZS3101;
○ Heat bending of bars is prohibited
Verifying Document - Pre-Pour Inspection, Bar bending schedule
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Formwork
Acceptance Criteria - Formwork to be constructed so that finished concrete will be to the shape, lines and levels shown on the drawings;
○ All forms shall be designed such that exposed concrete edges have a min 20mm chamfer unless otherwise indicated on the drawing;
○ Interior surfaces of the forms shall be treated with a release agent. Any reinforcement in contact with the release agent shall be cleaned thoroughly;
○ Forms to be sufficiently watertight to prevent grout loss
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Formwork and Pour
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Concrete Placement
Specification Reference - AS/NZS 4671: 2001, 'NZS 3109, 26.1.16 Handling and Placing
Acceptance Criteria - Provide a minimum of 24 hours notice of each initial intention to place concrete to the engineer.
○ Concreting to be a continous operation between ends of members and/or properly formed construction joints.
○ Concrete should be placed as close to its final position as practical and drop height shall not exceed 2m.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Concrete Test Cylinders
Acceptance Criteria - A set of specimens for compression tests shall consist of 3 specimens from each sample of concrete. 1no. tested at 7 days and 2no. tested at 28 days.
○ Strength of concrete = Dependent on Mix Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Approved Concrete Mix Design
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm correct mix design brought to site
○ Concrete placement method that the mix was designed for - Pump Mix
○ Type of supplementary cementitious materials (if used);
○ Slump (target and actual slump when measured);
○ Associated Products e.g. cement and additives
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Slump Test
Acceptance Criteria - Slump tests shall be taken for each truckload of concrete and when compressive testing samples are taken. Slump spread test if slump could exceed 210mm.
Nominated slump (mm) || Tolerance for snatch sample (mm)
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Time Limits
Acceptance Criteria - Incorporated in the works within 90minutes of batching.
○ Incorporated in the works within 30minutes of discharge from concrete truck/agitator
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Concrete Vibration
Acceptance Criteria - All compaction of concrete shall be carried out in accordance with Clause 7.6 of NZS 3109 as further modified by the following provisions: -
○ All concrete shall be thoroughly compacted during and immediately after depositing, by means of power driven immersion vibrators of a size suitable for the section being poured.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Curing
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete to be cured for min 3 days;
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Survey as-built
Acceptance Criteria - As-built survey CAD File
Verifying Document - As-built survey CAD File
Customer Requirements Verification Record / Location/ Hold Points

Acceptance Criteria - Photos with tape measure to show depth of topsoil layer. Date and location to be recorded

Specification Reference - Hazardous waste and contamined soils encountered during the excavation process
Acceptance Criteria - Contractor to advise the engineer if type R2, U or H materials are unexpectedly encountered
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Project Spec Cl.15.6.6
Specification Reference - Continuous visual assessments conducted with Stantec Representative. Contractor to address design change if instructed
Acceptance Criteria - Agreement with Engineer's Rep
Verifying Document - As Required by Stantec Representative, QC-01 Earthworks Checksheet
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Project Spec Cl.15.6.7
Specification Reference - Post-construction - Excavation of batters complying with design issued and within tolerance
Acceptance Criteria - Slope Tolerance 1H:1V or Flatter: +300 / -300 mm
Verifying Document - As-Built and DN-QUA-QC-01 Earthworks Checksheet

Specification Reference - Moisture sensitive material stockpiled
Acceptance Criteria - Drainage blanket (polythene cover) if any material is stored on site to avoid saturation

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - TNZ F/1 Cl.9.2, Project Spec Cl 17.1.5 - 17.1.10
Specification Reference - Trimming & Compaction of in-situ subgrade. Conduct plateau test.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - TNZ F/1 Cl.9.2, Project Spec Cl 17.1.5 - 17.1.11
Acceptance Criteria - 1 blow per 100mm is the minimum requirement for general fill placement
Frequency - Scala Tests: Within lane lines staggered wheel path every 10m. Shoulder every 10m.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - TNZ F/1 Cl.9.2, Project Spec Cl 17.1.5 - 17.1.12
Acceptance Criteria - Top of subgrade 3.3mm 90th percentile with maximum of 4.0mm
Frequency - Beam Tests: Within lane lines staggered wheel path every 10m. Shoulder every 10m.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - TNZ F/1 Cl.9.2, Project Spec Cl 17.1.5 - 17.1.13
Acceptance Criteria - As instructed by the Engineer
Verifying Document - Visual Assessment - Sign off on ConQA by Engineer
Frequency - Proof Roll: Full surface using suitable plant
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Project Spec Cl 15.6.11
Specification Reference - On-site Testing - NDM, Visual, Shear Vane
Acceptance Criteria - Complete the trial compaction as specified in project specification (15.6.11). Engineer to witness the trial compaction and release H P
Verifying Document - NDM Worksheet, Shear Vane Worksheet, Plateau Density Sheet
Frequency - When a new type of fill material is used
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Project Spec Cl.15.3.8
Specification Reference - Uncompacted thickness of each fill layer and trial fill section meeting the degree of compaction
Acceptance Criteria - Fill placement not exceeding 230mm
Verifying Document - Visual, Site Photos and NDM check sheets, DN-QUA-QC-09 NDM Worksheet
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Project Spec Cl.15.6.12
Specification Reference - Water Content, Standard Proctor and Wet Sieve.
Frequency - WC - 1 test per 400m3 with 2 tests minimum per day, MDD & WS - 1 test per 2000m3
Specification Reference - Compaction test by plateau
Acceptance Criteria - Plateau Testing to determine true MDD value based on site conditions
Verifying Document - DNZ Plateau Test work sheet
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Project Spec Cl.15.6.10, Project Spec Cl.15.6.12
Specification Reference - NDM and OMC testing of fill material, Shear Vane
Acceptance Criteria - Moisture Content: between-2% and +4% of OMC
○ Insitu Density: average of 98% of materials MDD over 5 consecutive tests. No single result less than 95%
○ Shear Vane 150kPa average for 10 consecutive readings with no result less than 120kPa (Cohesive soil only)
Verifying Document - NDM Record Sheet, DN-QUA-QC-09 NDM Worksheet, Shear Vane Sheet (Cohesive soil only)
Frequency - NDM - 1 test per 200m3 of fill placed, and, a minimum of 5 tests per day
○ Shear Vane - 1 test per 100m3 and additional test at NDM location (Cohesive soil only)
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Project Spec Cl. 15.3.11
Specification Reference - Survey of finished surface
